I have to use the manual ip option to connect to to my pc and it took me a while to even find my PC's ip. So the autoconnect is not working for me. I also think there should be an option on the PC app to find your ip for this very problem.
replyContent: The option to see your PC's local IP is noted. You can contact support@riftcat.com and they should be able to help you resolve the problem of not being able to automatically connect.

content: I was looking for a low cost solution for VR. and the app sounded promising. However, there was a connectivity issue to the riftcat almost all the time. I thought changing from 5ghz initially to 2.4 ghz may solve the issue, and it ended up connecting and not disconnecting, but the latency was close to half a second or more. (500 to 1000 ms). Already contacted support asking for a refund. If you are looking for a low-cost solution like me, I'd suggest saving money to get a real VR headset + controller. This may get you foot into the door, but definitely not a sustainable option. controller used in: Samsung S3 (maybe too old? but the calibration was way off) Samsung Note 4, LG V40, Pixel (This worked but again, high latency on 2.4 ghz)
won't connect
replyContent: Contact support@riftcat.com and they will check what causes connection issues for you.

content: I use it and I do riftcat VR but when I do that and play the controller is stuck :/ I need a refund
replyContent: You need to contact support@riftcat.com then.

content: Half the time it doesn't connect, the other half it's stuck and not moving. Should add a demo version to see the controller actually works.
replyContent: You can contact support@riftcat.com and they can look into your connection issues. If needs be, we can issue a refund.

content: Motion controller not working on LG K3...
replyContent: LG K3 lacks both magnetometer and gyroscope which is probably the cause for rotational tracking not working. Contact support@riftcat.com and we'll issue a refund.

content: the burton layout hard for 6.5 8nch phone
Why is tracking not working on Moto G5 and Moyo G5 plus but it works on Xiaomi redmi note 7?
replyContent: It's something we are investigating right now.

content: I really don't get why this app has such poor reviews. Out of all the features of VRidge / RiftCat, this is by far the most reliable! I use an Asus Zenfone 3 Lazer as my left hand and a Galaxy S5 as my right hand. Yes the Asus is a little choppy, but I blame that on its lack of 5 ghz wifi. The S5 performs extremely well and works with absolutely zero hiccups. The only issue that had occurred for me is that I had to manually input my IP address to get it to connect, but that's the only issue so far. I'd like to request a few changes however, if I may: 1. A slightly better UI for the button layout... My Zenfone 3 Laser is a 5.5" phone and I have a hard time reaching the edges of its display... I'd suggest that the buttons be moved closer to the hand the phone is assigned to, and also that they match the Vive's layout a little more. (Ex, menu on top?) It'd be cool if grip was on the same edge that you're holding the phone on too. 2. Better tracking... I understand it's hard as it is to create the system you have for hand tracking, but many games require you to be able to point at an object that you're holding to say return to their main menu (Blastworld), and some games just straight up don't work unless you can move your hands in full 3D space. It would be cool if you could at least extend your arms and have that be mapped out! But other than that, I really like this app and will be purchasing the full RiftCat soon!
replyContent:
1) Something we can look into, because we created HUD based on our phones and hands, which varies person to person.
2) We are considering adding gesture like "reach out". Full positional tracking is unlikely because phones just don't have the capabilities to do so, at least as a hand controller.

content: This app doesnt really work having some of the issues noted in these comments...
replyContent: You can contact our support and they will investigate. Sometimes the same problem has different root causes. Also it's always possible to receive refund, just contact support@riftcat.com.

content: In the best cases this app kinda sort of works. In the rest, it's just an exercise in frustration.

I can't seem to find a vridge connection no matter what I do.. üò§üò•üò≠ -Edit- I figured out my problem. The app works.. I had to manually connect with an IP address.. However I don't have the right device for this app unfortunately.. I have a tablet that works with but, it's too big to hold in my small hands. Then there's the phone that I use for the headset. I might have to see if I can get a couple of cheap phones that have the sensors on them.
replyContent: Make sure that your PC network profile is set to private and firewall/antivirus aren't blocking VRidge connection. You can always contact support@riftcat.com for assistance.

content: Wow is really does suck it will not find the app on my pc will not connect totally useless, why would Riftcat Client not have its IP displayed anywhere so you can do it manually, maybe add a free demo version so we can see it it works before purchasing... refunded.
replyContent: If VRidge controller doesn't see your PC then we cannot display its local IP because we don't know it. It's designed for when you have your PC hidden from LAN so you can still connect via local IP.

content: why the controller always tilt 90 degrees, not facing up? i must tilt my phone to use it normally, and its make so difficult to operate it
replyContent: We found out that holding your phone sideways (so the screen faces left rather than up) fits better in the hand and it's much easier to press buttons.

replyContent: That's odd, you can send message to support@riftcat.com and they will be able to issue a refund or help you resolve the problem if you want.

content: How do you refund your money?

content: Works just as well as my oculus go remote! Given my phone has gyroscrope, i can see some smart phones not being to work if its too old of a device.

Drifts constantly. Controls not customizable. Reset button doesnt seem to work fine. if i lay the phone flat, the controller is always facing sideways. Not bad but consider making a trial version, would like to see improvements
replyContent: Unfortunately drift is highly dependant on internal sensors. It could be that with drifting the center also drifts which causes the reset button to seem not working properly. Also default position is by holding phone sideways in a hand so laying it flat on table will be sideways.

Janky tracking, jerks back and forth really fast, also have to buy Riftcat for $15
replyContent: Precision of accuracy of tracking highly depends on the quality of phone's internal sensors. It's recommended to use phone with gyroscope to minimize drift and shakiness.

replyContent: VRidge controller can only be connected through WiFi. Wired connection didn't quite make sense for us, especially for Controller therefore it's not possible to connection through USB tethering.

content: I can't get this app to work for the life of me. First I spent $15 to get the program to run on my computer. Then I shell add another $5. To then have the application that I paid for not work I've been trying for 3 plus days to try to get this to work. Who and where can I get in contact with somebody to help me with this that's not going to take 3 to 5 business days. Unless somebody can give me an answer here in this section as to why my Samsung Grand Prime 5.1.1 version can't connect.
replyContent: We offer free trial to everybody. It allows you to play for 10 minutes per session. Restarting SteamVR resets the timer so you can test as many times as you want. You can contact support@riftcat.com and they'll help you out resolving the issue. Keep in mind that next week begins a holiday season in Poland so a lot of people take some days off work.

content: Works great on a Xiaomi mi A2. I would love to be able to change the rotation of the phone in my hand because it's not easy to play a lot of time with the current configuration. Also an option to lock the hand would be appreciated. Good job guys!

It works, but not particularly well. I am a great fan of the Vridge/Riftcat client, but I am not enamoured of this particular app.The buttons are laid out curiously. No quit option, so i have to kill the app in a task manager. In the SteamVR world, the reset button just resets you to the same point all the time. I've been using it with a Galaxy S4, in working order, and it doesn't perform very well. I appreciate performance is subject to a given phone's accelerometer, but if something like my old S4 can't make decent use of it, I'm not sure what generation of phone we should be using with it. That said, didn't expect much. Worst tho, it simply doesn't work on Star Trek Bridge Crew, which runs well in Riftcat on my S9 and is why I bought the Controller app. But doesn't see it as a Vive/Rift controller at startup when it asks you to click a button on said controller and cannot proceed. Fix this and I'll give more stars.  Finally, the video tutorial for the Controller doesn't tell you anything about the Vridge config, which is ambiguous - if you have keyboard or controller switched on, it will create addition controllers in SteamVR for them too and things start to break. Needs fixing.

works but has a few issues with tracking. seems like its track iij ng a 3d sphere and when I tilt the phone it moves around that sphere. also the position is way off even after clicking the reset button to recollaborate it.

good alternative to expensive VR. it is comparable to the oculus go controller. paired with an oculus go + go controller and you have a good VR headset to play beat saber or rec room! thanks a lot for this app
no posisinal tracking. Making it hard to do anything in VR with it.
replyContent: Positional tracking is not something that can be easily done with a phone. There is a reason why headsets like Vive or Oculus Rift comes with additional hardware, sensors/base stations, to provide positional tracking. VRidge controller is somewhere between 3dof and 6dof but not fully 6dof.
